body_html: @zou3519 The pass/fail check happens outside of multiprocessing and the subprocess is actually guaranteed to return something (True or False) and exit in normal case. However if _test_multinomial_invalid_probs ends up in an infinite loop, the subprocess will definitely hang, but we probably shouldn't let it happen in the first place.
body_text: @zou3519 The pass/fail check happens outside of multiprocessing and the subprocess is actually guaranteed to return something (True or False) and exit in normal case. However if _test_multinomial_invalid_probs ends up in an infinite loop, the subprocess will definitely hang, but we probably shouldn't let it happen in the first place.
body: @zou3519 The pass/fail check happens outside of multiprocessing and the subprocess is actually guaranteed to return something (True or False) and exit in normal case. However if `_test_multinomial_invalid_probs` ends up in an infinite loop, the subprocess will definitely hang, but we probably shouldn't let it happen in the first place.
